question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable whenever possible. Could you help me write a gym membership management system?

checklist.title: Is the core membership management functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the system includes essential member CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete), membership type definitions, and expiration handling. Score 0 if these core functions are missing, 5 if only basic operations are implemented without validation, and 10 if the system includes comprehensive membership management with proper data validation and business rules.

checklist.title: Is the payment and billing system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code includes payment processing, recurring billing, invoice generation, and payment history tracking. Check for integration with payment gateways or simulation of payment workflows. Deduct 5 points if there's no payment history tracking, and 3 points if recurring billing is not handled. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are gym access control and attendance tracking features included?
checklist.description: Review whether the system implements check-in/check-out functionality, attendance reports, access restrictions based on membership status, and capacity management. Deduct 5 points if there's no visual representation of attendance data, and 3 points if membership validation at check-in is inadequate. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the class/trainer scheduling system functional?
checklist.description: Assess if the code includes class/session scheduling, trainer assignment, member registration for classes, and conflict prevention. Check for calendar visualization, availability checking, and notification mechanisms. Deduct 3 points if there's no conflict detection, and 5 points if there's no visual calendar interface. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid inputs, database connection failures, concurrent operations, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Fitness progress tracking 2. Membership usage analytics 3. Automated member retention tools). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple ways to manage the same data) 2. Function modules unrelated to gym management (e.g., a built-in game) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating business logic/view/data access layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
